question: In spite of advances made in agriculture,many people around the world still go hungry. why is this case? what could be done about this problem?
text: Many people around the globe has to deal with hunger and famine, despite the huge agriculture advances.
There are a number of reasons for this problem, including overpopulation.
And various measures could be taken by consumers and governments to tackle this problem.

Although agricultural technology has been developed in many countries, overpopulation has made it harder to benefit from it. In other words, most people have limited access to healthy, affordable food. Take Somalia, for example, where it is a developing country, the number of an individual is much higher than the available food supplies. In addition, some nations have an unequal distribution of resources. This means that corruption and dysfunctional markets have caused some places, to over consume goods and others to suffer from lack of food. This imbalance of demand and supply results in many people being hungry.
